page.title: 12Quinton Village
page.content: Quinton is a very small village of approximately 250 inhabitants, living in a scattered community. There are no shops, post office, or public house, so the villagers rely on mobile traders, and the mobile library service. There is also a shuttle service to the local child welfare clinic. A private company, Johnson's Buses, runs a daily service into Northampton, with more services on Wednesdays and Saturdays, which are Market days. Local organisations present in the village include the Womens Institute, Guides and Brownies, a Youth Club, and Sunday School.
